main event: A UFO sighting occurred in Anita, Iowa and Topeka, Kansas on June 15, 1955.
interesting points: The UFO observed in Anita, Iowa was described as one orange-shaped object, two to six in length, with a blue and white glow. The color changed from red-orange to gray to orange again.

The UFO observed in Topeka, Kansas was described as one orange-shaped object, the size of a basketball, that was brilliant orange in color and appeared to be moving swiftly towards the moon, leaving a trail of light in its wake.
Both sightings occurred at the same date-time group of 10/03/52, 2303, on June 15, 1955.
The Topeka, Kansas sighting was observed by a military pilot.
The report indicates that additional data is still required for evaluation of the sightings.
sighted object: orange-shaped objects with various colors and characteristics
photographs: no photographs included in the report
